I am a software engineer.
short_description: As a Full Stack developer, I am committed to providing high-performance, secure, and fast solutions for web, mobile, and desktop applications. I specialize in database security, API integration, and leveraging artificial intelligence technologies to automate applications without manual intervention.
projectName3: EMG mobile application for doctors and all patients
projectName4: Real-time mobile application for tracking garbage trucks

education1.title: My Educational Journey
education1.deug_title: DEUG in Mathematics and Computer Science (SMI)
education1.bac_title: Baccalaureate in Physical Sciences and Chemistry (SPC)
education1.fsts: Faculty of Science and Technology - Settat

description.des1: Developed a vehicle inventory management application, including tracking, invoicing, and payment functionalities.
description.des2: Implemented a microservices architecture to ensure modularity and scalability of the solution.
description.des3: Used technologies such as Spring Boot, NestJS, Spring Security (JWT), Spring Data JPA, Docker, and Kubernetes.

description.des1: Developed a full-stack mobile task management application.
description.des2: Implemented a task tracking system for employees.

description.des1: Developed a mobile application for biomedical engineering students using Flutter, Arduino, and Bluetooth.
description.des2: Collected and displayed EMG data in real-time with Firebase integration.
description.des3: Created a doctor space to manage patients and send reports.

description.des1: Developed a mobile app for embedded systems engineering students using Flutter, Arduino with Wi-Fi, and GPS.
description.des2: Collected data and transferred it to the server to visualize trucks and bins in real-time on a map.

description.des1: Full-stack development of an online ISO 8583 parametric simulator designed for testers and analysts at HPS.
description.des2: Designed a microservices architecture ensuring performance, scalability, and independent component deployment.
description.des3: Enabled multi-institution and multi-user support, using Spring Boot and Kafka for efficient asynchronous communication.
